author: H.W. Brands
title: The Cherokee vs. the Cherokee
text:
A first lesson of history, for anyone paying serious attention, is that history is more complicated than you think. This is true almost regardless of how complicated you think it is; it’s more complicated than that. Casual visitors to the past often pose binary questions: Was the Civil War about slavery or states’ rights? Was the New Deal a good deal or a bad deal? Was Richard Nixon a conservative or a liberal? Such questions aren’t worthless as discussion-provokers, but the correct answer is always both. And when offered more than two choices, the honest student of history responds: All of the above.
